snippet: The reading of the entire Tibetan-language Buddhist canon, which is rarely undertaken, took about 40 days, and Dayangji Sherpa, 54, spent her life savings to make it happen.
abstract: Dayangji Sherpa of Queens spends her life savings to sponsor a rare ceremony in which all 108 books of the Tibetan-language Buddhist canon, the Kangyur, are read out loud by monks over a period of nearly 40 days; photos (M)
lead_paragraph: The reading of the entire Tibetan-language Buddhist canon, which is rarely undertaken, took about 40 days, and Dayangji Sherpa, 54, spent her life savings to make it happen.

headline.seo: Unlikely Sponsor Underwrites Buddhist Kangyur Ceremony in Queens
headline.main: A Rare Buddhist Ceremony in Queens, Paid for With a Life’s Savings
headline.print_headline: A Rare Buddhist Ceremony in Queens, Paid For With a Life’s Savings
